00014     Net::Net(unsigned _threads)
00015     {
00016         lastNeuronId = 0;
00017         lastWeightId = 0;
00018         setThreadCount(_threads);
00019         learningHint = 0;
00020         biasId = addNeuron(ActivationFunction::Linear::Instance());
00021         addConnection(biasId, biasId, 1);
00022     } //Net
00023

00025     {
00026         if(!learningHint)
00027             delete learningHint;
00028     } //~Net

00031     Net::getThreadCount() const
00032     {
00033         return threadCount;

00036     void
00037     Net::setThreadCount(unsigned _threads)
00038     {
00039         cache.touch();
00040 
00041         if(_threads == 0)
00042         {
00043             threadCount = boost::thread::hardware_concurrency();
00044             return;
00045         }
00046 
00047         if(_threads < 1 || _threads > 64)
00048             throw Exception::RangeMismatch()<<"Net::run(): currently only up to 64 concurrent threads supported\n";
00049 
00050         threadCount = _threads;
00051     } //setThreadCount

00053     unsigned
00054     Net::addNeuron(ActivationFunction::Base* _activationFunction)
00055     {
00056         cache.touch();
00057 
00058         pair<NeuronIter, bool> result = neurons.insert( pair<unsigned, Neuron>(lastNeuronId, Neuron(_activationFunction)) );
00059 
00060         if(!result.second)
00061             throw Exception::ElementExists()<<"Net::addNeuron(): insertion of neuron "<<lastNeuronId<<" failed\n";
00062 
00063         return lastNeuronId++;
00064     } //addNeuron

00066     unsigned
00067     Net::addInputNeuron()
00068     {
00069         unsigned neuronId = addNeuron(ActivationFunction::Linear::Instance());
00070         setNeuronRole(neuronId, Net::InputNeuron);
00071 
00072         return neuronId;

00075     void
00076     Net::delNeuron(unsigned _neuronId)
00077     {
00078         cache.touch();
00079 
00080         NeuronIter n = findNeuron(_neuronId);
00081 
00082         //Delete all connections to/from current neuron
00083         for(list<Link>::iterator link_iter = n->second.links.begin(); link_iter != n->second.links.end(); )
00084         {
00085             //We will delete link, so we can't use link_iter to get access to Link object
00086             //Copy Link attributes unsignedo local variables
00087             NeuronIter to = link_iter->getToIter();
00088             Link::Direction dir = link_iter->getDirection();
00089             
00090             //Go to next Link (see for loop - it is without ++ statement)
00091             link_iter++;
00092 
00093             if(dir == Link::in)
00094                 delConnection(to->first, n->first);
00095             else
00096                 delConnection(n->first, to->first);
00097         }
00098 
00099         //Actually delete Neuron object
00100         if( !neurons.erase(_neuronId) )
00101             throw Exception::ObjectNotFound()<<"Net::delNeuron(): can't delete neuron "<<_neuronId<<"\n";
00102     } //delNeuron

00104     void
00105     Net::setNeuronRole(unsigned _neuronId, NeuronRole _newRole)
00106     {
00107         cache.touch();
00108 
00109         NeuronIter iter = findNeuron(_neuronId);
00110 
00111         list< NeuronIter >::iterator inputIter = find(inputNeurons.begin(), inputNeurons.end(), iter);
00112 
00113         switch(_newRole)
00114         {
00115             case InputNeuron:
00116                 if(inputIter == inputNeurons.end())
00117                     inputNeurons.push_back(iter);
00118                 break;
00119             case WorkNeuron:
00120                 if(inputIter != inputNeurons.end())
00121                     inputNeurons.erase(inputIter);
00122                 break;
00123         }
00124     } //setNeuronRole

00126     Net::NeuronRole
00127     Net::getNeuronRole(unsigned _neuronId) const
00128     {
00129         /*
00130          * 0 - work neuron
00131          * 1 - work+input
00132          */
00133         unsigned role = 0;
00134 
00135         ConstNeuronIter iter = findNeuron(_neuronId);
00136 
00137         if(find(inputNeurons.begin(), inputNeurons.end(), iter) != inputNeurons.end())
00138             role+=1;
00139 
00140         return (NeuronRole)role;
00141     } //getNeuronRole

00143     void
00144     Net::addConnection(unsigned _from, unsigned _to, Float _weightValue)
00145     {
00146         cache.touch();
00147 
00148         NeuronIter from = findNeuron(_from);
00149         NeuronIter to = findNeuron(_to);
00150 
00151         pair<WeightIter, bool> result = weights.insert( pair<unsigned, Weight>(lastWeightId++, Weight(_weightValue)) );
00152         if(!result.second)
00153             throw Exception::ElementExists()<<"Net::addWeight(): insertion of new weight failed\n";
00154 
00155         from->second.links.push_back( Link(to, Link::out, result.first) );
00156         to->second.links.push_back( Link(from, Link::in, result.first) );
00157 
00158         result.first->second.usageCount = 2;
00159     } //addConnection
00160 
00161     void
00162     Net::delConnection(unsigned _from, unsigned _to)
00163     {
00164         cache.touch();
00165         
00166         NeuronIter from_niter = findNeuron(_from);
00167         NeuronIter to_niter   = findNeuron(_to);
00168 
00169         /* Short unsignedroduction:
00170          * Neuron_from               Neuron_to
00171          *  Link                      Link
00172          *    to =>Neuron2              to =>Neuron1
00173          *    w  =>weight1              w  =>weight1
00174          *    dir=>out                  dir=>in
00175          */
00176 
00177         //Find correspondent Links in neurons
00178         list<Link>::iterator from_liter = from_niter->second.findLink(to_niter, Link::out);
00179         list<Link>::iterator to_liter = to_niter->second.findLink(from_niter, Link::in);
00180 
00181         //weight1 (see picture) must be common for both Link objects
00182         if(from_liter->getWeightIter() != to_liter->getWeightIter())
00183             throw Exception::Unbelievable()<<"Net::delConnection(): symmetric links don't share weight\n";
00184 
00185         //We will delete Link objects and iterators to common weight will be lost
00186         WeightIter w_iter = from_liter->getWeightIter();
00187 
00188         //Actually delete Link objects from Neuron_to and Neuron_from
00189         from_niter->second.links.erase(from_liter);
00190         to_niter->second.links.erase(to_liter);
00191 
00192         //Delete weight object if it no more used
00193         if( (w_iter->second.usageCount -= 2) == 0) 
00194             weights.erase(w_iter->first);
00195 
00196     } //delConnection

00221     void
00222     Net::setInput(const valarray<Float>& _input)
00223     {
00224         if(_input.size() < inputNeurons.size())
00225             throw Exception::SizeMismatch()<<"setInput(): Supplied input size is smaller "
00226                                                           "then number of input neurons\n";
00227 
00228         if(_input.size() > inputNeurons.size())
00229             Exception::Warning()<<"setInput(): Input size is bigger then input neurons count. "
00230                                                "Check getInputMap() output\n";
00231 
00232         unsigned i = 0;
00233         BOOST_FOREACH( NeuronIter iter, inputNeurons)
00234             iter->second.receptiveField += _input[i++];
00235     } //setInput

00237     map<unsigned, Float>
00238     Net::getOutput() const
00239     {
00240         map<unsigned, Float> result;
00241 
00242         if( !cache.isOk() )
00243             regenerateCache();
00244 
00245         if(cache.data.size() < 2)
00246             return result;
00247 
00248         BOOST_FOREACH( NetCache::ThreadTaskType& task, cache.data[cache.data.size() - 2])
00249             BOOST_FOREACH( NeuronIter& iter, task )
00250                 result.insert(pair<unsigned, Float>(iter->first, iter->second.activationValue));
00251 
00252         return result;
00253     } //getOutput
00254 
00255     void
00256     Net::getOutput(valarray<Float>& _output) const
00257     {
00258         map<unsigned, Float> output = getOutput();
00259         _output.resize(output.size());
00260 
00261         unsigned i = 0;
00262         for(map<unsigned, Float>::const_iterator iter = output.begin(); iter != output.end(); ++iter)
00263             _output[i++] = iter->second;
00264     } //getOutput
00265 
00266     void
00267     Net::run(Runner* _runner)
00268     {
00269         if( !cache.isOk() )
00270             regenerateCache();
00271 
00272         boost::thread_group threadPool;
00273         boost::barrier barrier(threadCount);
00274 
00275         for(unsigned thread = 0; thread < threadCount; ++thread)
00276             threadPool.add_thread( new boost::thread(Net::threadBase, _runner, &cache, thread, &barrier) );
00277         
00278         //wait for threads to finish
00279         threadPool.join_all();
00280     } //run

00306     NeuronIter
00307     Net::findNeuron(unsigned _neuronId)
00308     {
00309         NeuronIter iter = neurons.find(_neuronId);
00310         if(neurons.end() == iter)
00311             throw Exception::ObjectNotFound()<<"findNeuron(): Neuron "<<_neuronId<<" not found\n";
00312 
00313         return iter;
00314     } //findNeuron

00322     void
00323     Net::formatFront(vector<NeuronIter>& _raw) const
00324     {
00325         cache.data.push_back( NetCache::FrontType() );
00326         NetCache::FrontType& tasks = cache.data[cache.data.size() - 1];
00327 
00328         for(unsigned i = 0; i < threadCount; i++)
00329             tasks.push_back( vector<NeuronIter>() );
00330 
00331         sort(_raw.begin(), _raw.end(), NeuronIterCompare());
00332         vector<NeuronIter>::iterator it = unique(_raw.begin(), _raw.end(), NeuronIterCompare::equal);
00333         _raw.resize( it - _raw.begin() );
00334 
00335         for(unsigned i = 0; i < _raw.size(); ++i)
00336             tasks[_raw[i]->second.getOwnerThread() % threadCount].push_back(_raw[i]);
00337     } //formatFront
00338 
00339     void
00340     Net::regenerateCache() const
00341     {
00342         cache.flush(); 
00343 
00344         //Here we will place neuron's IDs that will become front, with duplicates
00345         vector<NeuronIter> rawFront;
00346 
00347         /*
00348          * Function operates with "hops" attribute of every Neuron
00349          * to build adequate cache.
00350          * Unfortunetly, map<unsigned, Neuron>::iterator doesn't have operator< , so
00351          * we shold write own comparison class for hops<>. I placed it to Utils.h
00352          */
00353         map<NeuronIter, unsigned, NeuronIterCompare> hops;
00354         
00355         //Put inputNeurons to front
00356         BOOST_FOREACH( NeuronIter iter, inputNeurons )
00357         {
00358             rawFront.push_back(iter);
00359             hops[iter] = 1;
00360         }
00361         formatFront(rawFront);
00362         
00363         //Bias neuron is kind of input neuron
00364         NeuronIter biasIter = const_cast<Net*>(this)->findNeuron(biasId);
00365         cache.data[0][0].push_back(biasIter);
00366 
00367         /*
00368          * Cache looks like this:
00369          *
00370          * vector<FrontType> cache.data
00371          *     |
00372          *     |-(0) vector<ThreadTaskType>      <-- * front pounsigneder pounsigneds to this vector
00373          *     |-(1) vector<ThreadTaskType>
00374          *     |-(...)
00375          *     |-(number_of_layers) vector<ThreadTaskType>
00376          *                          |
00377          *                          |-(0) vector<Neuron*> Target neurons for thread1
00378          *                          |-(1) vector<Neuron*> Target neurons for thread2
00379          *
00380          *  At this pounsigned cache.data(0) is the only record and it contains input neurons
00381          */
00382 
00383         do {
00384             /*
00385              * We have better prepare next front
00386              * At first iteration, if you remember, vector<unsigned> _raw contains unique inputNeurons indexes
00387              */
00388             unsigned nCount = rawFront.size();
00389             for(unsigned i = 0; i < nCount; ++i)
00390             {
00391                 //pop_front emulation
00392                 NeuronIter currentNeuronIter = rawFront[0];
00393                 rawFront.erase( rawFront.begin() );
00394 
00395                 //ok, we've got cur_neuron. We will iterate through his Out links
00396                 //and push_back their opposite sides to rawFront
00397                 BOOST_FOREACH( Link& link, currentNeuronIter->second.links )
00398                 {
00399                     //Only feedforward links
00400                     if(link.getDirection() == Link::in)
00401                         continue;
00402 
00403                     /*
00404                      * Short comment. Consider following topology (hops are in brackets):
00405                      *   +(0)    <-- output          +(0)             +(3)    <-- front(3)
00406                      *  / \                         / \              / \
00407                      * +(0)+(0)         ======>    +(0)+(0)  ====>  +(2)+(2)  <-- front(2)
00408                      *  \ /           iteration1    \ /        N     \ /
00409                      *   +(0)  <-- input             +(1)             +(1)    <-- front on iteration1
00410                      *
00411                      *   For current neuron (C) and other neuron (T), hops might be:
00412                      *   T = 0  - T-neuron is fresh. We will set T=C+1
00413                      *   T = N, N < C - it is recurrent link. Dont touch T and dont place it unsignedo rawFront
00414                      *   T = C  - it is stupid recursive topology. Currently unsupported. Raise exception
00415                      *   T = C, but t=c  - it is recurrent link over 1 neuron. It is supported
00416                      *   T = C + 1 - T already hadled. Silently ignore T. We can add T to rawFront
00417                      *   T > C + 1 - impossible. Somebody changed hops by hand and didn't touch cache or
00418                      *               after last cache generation algorithm didn't set neuron's hops to zero
00419                      */
00420 
00421                     //Assume that when cache becomes coherent, all neuron[hops] vars become zero
00422                     if(hops[link.getToIter()] == 0)
00423                         hops[link.getToIter()] = hops[currentNeuronIter] + link.getLatency();
00424 
00425                     if(hops[link.getToIter()] == hops[currentNeuronIter] + 1)
00426                         rawFront.push_back(link.getToIter()); 
00427 
00428                     if(hops[link.getToIter()] == hops[currentNeuronIter] && 
00429                             link.getToIter()->first != currentNeuronIter->first)
00430                         throw Exception::Unbelievable()<<"Net::run(): cur_neuron.hops == to.hops. "
00431                                                             "There is no support for such topologies yet\n";
00432                 } //BOOST_FOREACH( Link )
00433 
00434             } //rawFront iteration ( Neuron )
00435 
00436             //new rawFront formed
00437             formatFront(rawFront);
00438             
00439         } while( rawFront.size() > 0 );
00440 
00441         //We rebuilded cache
00442         cache.fixed();
00443 
00444     } //regenerateCache
00445
